meanings.definition: An act of leaving a place or situation without looking back.
meanings.sent1: After the argument, his walkaway from the room was swift and silent.
meanings.sent2: She made a walkaway from the party when she felt uncomfortable.
meanings.sent3: The walkaway from the boring meeting was the most exciting part of his day.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to walkaway from the toxic relationship was like stepping into a new world.
meanings.sent5: The walkaway from the haunted house felt like escaping a nightmare.

meanings.definition: A person who leaves a situation or relationship without any intention of returning.
meanings.sent1: He became known as the office walkaway after abruptly quitting his job.
meanings.sent2: The walkaway from her ex-boyfriend was the best decision she ever made.
meanings.sent3: The walkaway from the party left everyone wondering where he went.
meanings.sent4: She was a walkaway from drama, always avoiding conflicts.
meanings.sent5: The walkaway from his past was a fresh start towards a brighter future.
